title: Tulsa police say man killed his wife, 2 sons, then himself
content:
TULSA, Okla. (AP) — Police say a man apparently fatally shot his wife and two young sons before killing himself at their family home in Tulsa.
Sgt. Dave Walker said in a news release that a 42-year-old man, his 38-year-old wife and their 6- and 10-year-old sons were found shot to death Wednesday. Their names have not yet been released.
“The evidence indicates that the father shot and killed the children and the wife before turning the gun on himself,” Walker said. “There is evidence of multiple gunshots throughout the house. All the bodies were found in different rooms throughout the house.”
There was no indication of forced entry and no suspects are being sought, Walker said.
Police Capt. Matt McCord said officers found a handgun near the man’s body. The woman’s employer requested a welfare check after she failed to show up for work or call in sick for two days.
Neighbors said they were shocked by the events and called the area safe.
Most every property in the neighborhood has a large fence, so children can play or swim in privacy, though some play hoops in the driveway or at a cul-de-sac.
“I love this neighborhood. It’s very quiet here,” Mercedes Perez told The Associated Press.
